intro: Sabal havanensis, commonly known as the Cuban palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the island of Cuba and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and feather-like leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, and it produces edible fruits that are consumed by various wildlife. Sabal havanensis plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
